title: The Dow Rose 122 Points Because Investors Smell Another Rate Cut
text:
Back and Forth. U.S. stocks posted their first positive session in the fourth quarter. Mounting hope for an interest-rate cut sent the three major U.S. stock market indexes higher, but downbeat data of the service sector has added to concerns that the weakness in manufacturing might be spilling over to other parts of the economy. Investors now await Friday’s jobs report for further signals on a potential economic downturn. In today’s After the Bell, we...

look at the hopes and despair that drove the market’s movement today; wonder what September’s jobs report will look like; and expect a bumpy ride going forward....
description: U.S. stocks posted their first positive session in the fourth quarter. Mounting hope for an interest-rate cut in October sent the three major U.S. stock market indexes higher.
